stories.title: A simple diff tool in the browser

stories.text:
By just not using it. That's all. It's that easy.

This will be my last comment on the internet.

I am done with Distraction Capitalism.

But none of you will care or notice, because you are too distracted. But comment if you want. I will not be reading them.

Alexa tells 10-year-old girl to put penny in plug socket
Is there such a thing as “infinity”? (1997)
‘I do surfing’: an AI-generated Mark Zuckerberg on Facebook’s bad year
Most important things that I learned this year as a 19-year-old startup founder

stories.text: Human-Computer interaction is necessarily subjective simulation, cognitive oversimplification, and perceptually premature optimization. Do more, with less. Delegate control responsibly to autonomous systems; They have capability but lack reason. Humans are error-correcting. Future utopia entails watching robots work, and pressing button when they make mistakes and act funny. Also human-human relations coordinations to ultimately solve problems which haven't had solutions engineered for yet, most often for unknown unknowns, less frequently manufacturing fault, and certainly never again operator error. Systems directing themselves, able to start entirely new industrial processes. Human supervision mandatory. Society doesn't autopilot, individuals do. The next step in human evolution - You.
stories.title: Tell HN: The next step in human evolution (poem)
